results.title: The Effectiveness of Statins as Potential Therapy for Multiple Sclerosis: A Systematic Review of Randomized Controlled trials
results.text_hl: For the @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@ trial, Chataway and co-authors presented the difference in EDSS at 24 months between @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ and placebo groups.

results.title: Increased cholesterol synthesis drives neurotoxicity in patient stem cell-derived model of multiple sclerosis.
results.text_hl: SASP from @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@PMS@@@ iNSC lines induced @DISEASE_Neurotoxicity_Syndromes @DISEASE_MESH:D020258 @@@neurotoxicity@@@ in mature neurons, and treatment with the @GENE_HMGCR @GENE_3156 @@@HMGCR@@@ inhibitor @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ altered the @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@PMS@@@ iNSC SASP, promoting cytoprotective qualities and reducing @DISEASE_Neurotoxicity_Syndromes @DISEASE_MESH:D020258 @@@neurotoxicity@@@.

results.title: Evaluating the effectiveness of simvastatin in slowing the progression of disability in secondary progressive multiple sclerosis (MS-STAT2): protocol for a multicentre, randomised controlled, double-blind, phase 3 clinical trial in the UK.
results.text_hl: INTRODUCTION: There remains a high unmet need for disease-modifying therapies that can impact @DISEASE_Movement_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D009069 @@@disability@@@ progression in secondary progressive @DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009103 @@@multiple sclerosis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@). Following positive results of the phase 2 @DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009103 @@@MS@@@-STAT study, the @DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009103 @@@MS@@@-@GENE_STAT2 @GENE_6773 @@@STAT2@@@ phase 3 trial will evaluate the efficacy and cost-effectiveness of repurposed high-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in slowing the progression of @DISEASE_Movement_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D009069 @@@disability@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@.

results.title: The effects of HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors on disease activity in multiple sclerosis: A systematic review and meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: Add-on statins to @GENE_IFNB1 @GENE_3456 @@@IFN-beta@@@ were safe and well-tolerated. In @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@, stand-alone @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ led to significantly reduced annualized rate of whole-brain @DISEASE_Weight_Loss @DISEASE_MESH:D015431 @@@volume reduction@@@.

results.title: Investigating the relationship between thalamic iron concentration and disease severity in secondary progressive multiple sclerosis using quantitative susceptibility mapping: Cross-sectional analysis from the MS-STAT2 randomised controlled trial.
results.text_hl: Methods: Baseline data from a subgroup of the MS-@GENE_STAT2 @GENE_6773 @@@STAT2@@@ trial (@<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ vs. placebo in @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@, NCT03387670) were included.

results.title: Effect of high-dose simvastatin on brain atrophy and disability in secondary progressive multiple sclerosis (MS-STAT): a randomised, placebo-controlled, phase 2 trial.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ aged 18-65 years with @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@secondary progressive multiple sclerosis@@@ were randomly assigned (1:1), by a centralised web-based service with a block size of eight, to receive either 80 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or placebo.

results.title: Applying causal models to explore the mechanism of action of simvastatin in progressive multiple sclerosis
results.journal: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A
results.text_hl: We applied structural equation models to the @DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009103 @@@MS@@@-STAT trial in which 140 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@ were randomized to receive placebo or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

results.text_hl: @DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009103 @@@MS-STAT@@@ was a phase 2 trial of high-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (80 mg) in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@.

results.title: Disease-Modifying Treatment in Progressive Multiple Sclerosis.
results.text_hl: Smaller early phase studies of @CHEMICAL_Thioctic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008063 @@@alpha-lipoic acid@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ each found slowing of rate of whole @DISEASE_Microphthalmia_Syndromic_10 @DISEASE_MESH:C566985 @@@brain atrophy@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Multiple_Sclerosis_Chronic_Progressive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020528 @@@SPMS@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@.
